intro: Bucephalandra ultramafica, commonly known as the ultramafic bucephalandra, is a rare aquatic plant native to the ultramafic soils of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves that often exhibit a striking metallic sheen under light. The plant thrives in low-light conditions and requires moderate water flow to maintain its health. Its unique adaptation to nutrient-poor, acidic environments makes it a fascinating subject for botanical study. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for environmental changes.
